title.rendered: Top 5 Spring Getaway Destinations in Europe

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]March is the best time for a spring getaway somewhere in Europe! Rich culture, amazing cuisines, pleasant weather and many sights to see. Whether you opt for a weekend trip or a leisurely stay, the beauty of Europe is how easily you can flip between cities.

We have collected our favorite destinations:[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”104508″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”178858″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]Milan, Italy 

Best for: fashion

Sip an authentic Italian espresso at the Duomo di Milano, the city’s most important landmark,  while enjoying the sophisticated Italian style. Shopping and wardrobe upgrades are a must when you visit Milan. Milan also boasts plenty of its own cultural treasures that are worth seeing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]Marbella, Spain

Best for: summery feeling

Due to its micro-climate, Marbella enjoys 320 days of sunlight a year. Marbella lays below the Sierra Blanca mountain range, on the glamorous Costa del Sol. Enjoy Michelin-starred restaurants, designer boutiques, high-end resorts, super yachts and golf courses.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”104514″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”121480″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”104520″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”210736″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]Lisbon, Portugal

Best for: gastronomy

A hilly coastal capital with colorful buildings, trundling yellow trams, Fado music and amazing cuisine. Lisbon has managed to retain its sense of charm which is rarely seen in Europe’s capitals. It is worth visiting for the Portuguese gastronomy, which has kept true to its simple yet delicious traditions.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]Budapest, Hungary

Best for: city sights

Hungary’s capital is divided: the hilly Buda and the flat Pest, split by the Danube River running right through the middle. The two sides represent two different perspectives on life. This city is full of history, art and thermal baths, and also has a fascinating food and bar scene.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”18375″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”180563″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”104526″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”276238″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]Paris, France

Best for: Parisian feeling

World-class culture, Champs-Élysées, rich history, Chanel, excellent food scene and wine selection, chic boutiques, Hermès, cutting-edge concept stores, the Louvre, Yves Saint Laurent, café culture, charming patisseries, colorful macarons, vibrant neighborhoods, the Seine – this is Paris![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Book your jet now and pack your bags![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
